footerData.text: Created by Sam Murray. Translations Powered by

projects.title: Jazmyn - Voice Controlled Web Broswing Plugin
projects.desc: For Artificial Intelligence, my partner and I utilized an existing voice-recognition API but created functionality where vocalized commands could be translated to machine actions, recorded, and recalled.

projects.title: Peer-2-Peer Chat Server w/Group Message Capabilities
projects.desc: For Object-Oriented Design, I created Java code that made and hosted a chat server on multicast sockets in an existing network that would identify other users running the same program and allowed for exchange of direct messages or group messages

projects.title: History Sniffing Chess Board
projects.desc: For Information Security, I created a webpage that mimicked a CAPCHA but could determine if the unassuming user had been to any subset of a list of links and would supply a message dependent on what parts of the chess board were clicked.

projects.title: Plagues, Prophets and People: High Priest Visual Journal
projects.desc: For a Theology class that I took in Israel, I created a Visual Journal to document the life of ancient Jewish High Priests and the restrictions that they encountered in daily life

projects.title: Intercultural Identity Paper
projects.desc: For Intercultural Communication, I wrote a paper exploring and defining Intercultural Identity which is the simoultaneous and continous definition of 'us' versus 'them' in all of life's contexts

projects.title: Center for the Common Good
projects.desc: The entirety of Project Management was seeing a project through its entire lifecycle. My group members and I were paired with the Center of the Common Good at the University of St. Thomas. They were looking for help in engagement with their main users - Students, Faculty, and Community Partner Service Organizations. We created frameworks for them to implement that would improve engagement in all 3 areas.

projects.title: Net Neutrality Investigation
projects.desc: For Business Law, my group members and I investigated the potential implications that could accompany a policy change regarding Net Neutrality

paragraphs.item: I am currently a senior at the University of St. Thomas and will graduate in May 2019 with degrees in Computer Science (B.A.) as well as Supply Chain & Operations Management (B.A.), with a minor in Data Analytics. At St. Thomas I played rugby all 4 years. In my time, I served as match secretary for 1 semester, and as captain for 1 year. I also am a member of the Supply Chain & Operations Club.
Professionally, I would eventually like to get into Data Science/Data Analytics, but I am beginning my career consulting with Optum in Eden Prairie Minnesota.

In my free time, I enjoy watching sports of all kinds, I am a fan of the Milwaukee Brewers and Bucks, Wisconsin Badgers, Minnesota Vikings and Wild, Arsenal FC, Saracens RFC. We are currently approaching the best sports time of the year with March Madness right around the corner.

news.item: Eligible for Summa Cum Laude Oral Examination (will be taken on April 15th, 2019)
Returned from Israel/Jordan Theology Trip on January 27th, 2019
Accepted job in Consulting Development Program at Optum. Will begin work July, 15 2017
Planned post-graduation vacation to New Zealand for early June

education.school: University of St. Thomas - Class of 2019
education.scomMajor: Major: Business Administration - Supply Chain & Operations Management (B.A.)

studyAbroad.jterm: January-Term: Theology 101 (Rome ‘16), UMAIE English (France & Italy '17), UST Theology 490 (Israel & Jordan ’19)

title.data: Technical EID Intern - Nacelle Transfer Function Root Cause Analysis

resp.info: Created MATLAB code to manipulate, visualize, and analyze wind turbine data and trends
Queried and manipulated data to identify opportunities and trends for potential cost savings

title.data: Computer and Information Sciences Department Tutor

resp.info: Examined Knotting Transitions in order to assist in Knot Theory research
Wrote scripts to identify and analyze tendencies of St. Thomas and opponents for game plan purposes
Assisted students who have questions in Java for Object-Oriented Design (2nd class in CS Progression)

work.title: Application Systems Analyst Intern
work.resp: Assisted IT and Analyst teams with Resource Management and implementation of a new ERP system.

work.title: File Clerk
work.resp: Scanned, filed, and organized client files.

work.title: Election Inspector
work.resp: Monitored election proceedings at the local polling station.

data.info: Rugby Football Club 15’s and 7’s Side (Match Secretary: Spring 2018)
